title: Signal Report — Holiday flagships: early-access test and phased discounts
highlights: Run an 8‑week early‑access test to isolate incremental demand from cannibalization
Phase discounts: smaller public promotions early, deeper loyalty/in‑store offers later to protect margin
Use a 10–14 day co‑branded pop‑up or civic flagship activation to measure visit‑to‑purchase conversion and local media impact
executive_summary: Operators should run a two‑phase holiday activation: an early‑access loyalty window two weeks ahead of last year, followed by a public phase, and measure across an 8‑week trial to separate incremental demand from cannibalized sales [^4]. Design the test to detect a 10–15% weekly foot‑traffic lift versus baseline and track per‑visit AOV and cohorted repeat rate to validate net revenue [^4]. Target early‑deal share to exceed last year by 20–30% as a test objective; in the next 30 days merchandisers, loyalty, operations and property/partnership teams must lock early‑access SKUs and discounts, instrument footfall/AOV tagging, and confirm one 10–14‑day co‑branded pop‑up or civic flagship activation for measurement [^4][^3][^1].
top_operator_moves: Launch an 8‑week early‑access loyalty test and instrument weekly footfall, per‑visit AOV, and repeat rate
Publish a phased discount calendar (light public early offers, deeper loyalty/in‑store exclusives later) and track margin by week
Secure and operationalize a 10–14 day co‑branded pop‑up or civic flagship event with landlord or city partner and tag its traffic for conversion analysis
